{{Expand Russian|Машкевич, Александр Антонович|date=October 2018}} {{Infobox person |name = Alexander Mashkevich |image = Alexander Mashkevitch.JPG |birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1954|2|23|df=y}}{{cite news|title=Машкевич Александр|url=https://tengrinews.kz/tag/%D0%9C%D0%B0%D1%88%D0%BA%D0%B5%D0%B2%D0%B8%D1%87-%D0%90%D0%BB%D0%B5%D0%BA%D1%81%D0%B0%D0%BD%D0%B4%D1%80/|accessdate=10 January 2017|work=Tengrin News}} |birth_place = [[Bishkek|Frunze]], [[Kyrgyz Soviet Socialist Republic|Kyrgyz SSR]] |death_date = |death_place = |other_names = |spouse = |known_for = |alma_mater = |occupation = Major shareholder in [[Eurasian Natural Resources Corporation]] |nationality = [[Israel]]i
[[Kazakhstan]] |website = }} '''Alexander Antonovich Mashkevich''' ({{lang-he|אלכסנדר משקביץ}}; also [[transliterated]] '''Alexandr Mashkevic'''; {{lang-ru|Александр Антонович Машкевич}}; born 23 February 1954) is a businessman and investor. He has major holdings and close political relationships in [[Kazakhstan]]. He holds both Kazakh and [[Israel]]i citizenship; according to the [[Jewish Telegraphic Agency]], he usually travels on his Israeli passport and "rarely spends more than a week each month in Kazakhstan."{{cite web|last=Krichevsky |first=Lev |date=18 October 2004 |url=http://www.ncsj.org/AuxPages/101804JTA_Mashkevich.shtml |title=Wealthy Kazakh businessman looks to make mark on Jewish world |work=www.ncsj.org |publisher=''[[Jewish Telegraphic Agency]]'' |accessdate=2007-02-17 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071026091634/http://www.ncsj.org/AuxPages/101804JTA_Mashkevich.shtml |archivedate=26 October 2007 }} ==Biography== Mashkevich was born in [[Bishkek|Frunze]], [[Kyrgyz SSR]], [[Soviet Union]], in 1954. His father Anton, a doctor born in [[Lithuania]], and his mother, Rakhel Yoffe, a lawyer born in [[Vitebsk]], were evacuated to Kyrgyzstan in 1941. His family background is [[Lithuanian Jews|Lithuanian Jewish]]. He is a graduate of Kyrgyz State University where he studied [[philology]]. Mashkevich started out an academic career but became a businessman during [[perestroika]]. Mashkevich, [[Patokh Chodiev]], and [[Alijan Ibragimov]] form "the Trio," a group of Kazakh businessmen who became billionaires. The Trio gained control of the recently privatized [[chromium]], [[alumina]], and [[gas]] operations in Kazakhstan (some of the largest ones in the world).{{cite news|date=24 July 2002|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/business/2146757.stm|title=The Steel Maharajah|work=BBC|publisher=[[BBC News]]|accessdate=2009-08-25}}{{cite web|last=Kazhegeldin|first=Akezhan|date=December 24, 2004|url=http://iicas.org/2004en/publ_30_12_04.htm|title=The end of the "controlled" democracy|work="Respublika"|publisher=International Eurasian Institute for Economic and Political Research|accessdate=2006-05-04| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20060506041451/http://iicas.org/2004en/publ_30_12_04.htm| archivedate= 6 May 2006 | deadurl= no}} With his partners Chodiev and Ibragimov, Mashkevich helped to develop these assets, and is a major shareholder in [[Eurasian National Resources Corporation]] (ENRC), now one of the world's leading natural resources groups. ENRC, based in London, operates a number of metals assets in Kazakhstan and Africa, having acquired numerous mining operations in [[Eastern Europe]] and [[Africa]]. In 2009, ENRC generated a $1,462 million profit on sales of $3.8 billion. ENRC was floated on the [[London Stock Exchange]] in December 2007, with a market capitalisation on Admission of approximately £6.8 billion. Mashkevich served as president of the Euro-Asian Jewish Congress (EAJC) until 2011. The EAJC is one of the five regional branches of [[World Jewish Congress|World Jewish Congress (WJC)]]. In this capacity, he has visited a number of [[synagogue]]s around the world and met with many prominent individuals. In 2002, Mashkevich had a private meeting with then-Foreign Minister [[Shimon Peres]].{{cite web|last=Galili |first=Lily |date=29 October 2002 |url=http://www.ncsj.org/AuxPages/102902Haaretz.shtml |title=A Kazakh Oligarch Trying To Be a Jewish Tycoon |work=www.ncsj.org |publisher=''[[Ha'aretz]]'' |accessdate=2007-02-17 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071011232308/http://www.ncsj.org/AuxPages/102902Haaretz.shtml |archivedate=11 October 2007 }} In apparent consultation with Israeli Defense Minister [[Binyamin Ben-Eliezer]], he asked his personal friend Kazakh President [[Nursultan Nazarbayev]] to intervene with [[Iran]] concerning Israeli soldiers captured by [[Hizbullah]]. Also, while in Israel, Mashkevich "several times rather closely cooperated" with Kazakh Ambassador, now Deputy Foreign Minister, Kairat Abdurakhmanov.{{cite web|last=Rozen|first=Sami|date=March 9, 2006|url=http://www.axisglobe.com/article.asp?article=722|title=Kazakh Historian Turned Deputy Minister After Stay in Israel|work=www.axisglobe.com|publisher=''Axis''|accessdate=2007-02-17| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20070303031635/http://www.axisglobe.com/article.asp?article=722| archivedate= 3 March 2007 | deadurl= no}} Mashkevich is one of the owners of [[Alferon Management]]. Based in [[London]], Alferon Management has acquired mining operations in different places: [[Zambia]], the [[Democratic Republic of Congo]], [[Indonesia]], [[Kosovo]], [[Russia]], and other countries.{{Citation needed|date=August 2009}} In 2010 he was on the ''[[Forbes]]'' list of billionaires at #287. In 2017, he was on the list at #1098, with a worth of $1.9 billion.[https://www.forbes.com/billionaires/list/26/#version:static] On April 6, 2011, Mashkevitch announced his intention to found a Jewish version of ''[[Al-Jazeera]]'' that would "represent Israel on an international level, with real information."[http://www.jpost.com/JewishWorld/JewishNews/Article.aspx?ID=215498&R=R1 Jerusalem Post: "Russian billionaire to found 'Jewish Al-Jazeera'"] April 7, 2011[http://www.jewishjournal.com/world/article/billionaire_mashkevich_quits_euro-asian_jewish_congress_presidency_20110627 Jewish Journal: "Billionaire Mashkevich quits Euro-Asian Jewish Congress presidency"] June 27, 2011 ==References== {{reflist}} == External links == {{commonscatinline}} * [https://www.forbes.com/lists/2010/10/billionaires-2010_Alexander-Machkevich_9O0N.html?&datatype=Person ''Forbes'' listing of Mashkevich] {{DEFAULTSORT:Mashkevich, Alexander}} [[Category:1954 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Bishkek]] [[Category:Israeli billionaires]] [[Category:Israeli businesspeople]] [[Category:Israeli investors]] [[Category:Israeli Jews]] [[Category:Israeli people of Lithuanian-Jewish descent]] [[Category:Soviet Jews]] [[Category:Kyrgyzstani Jews]] [[Category:Kazakhstani emigrants to Israel]] [[Category:Kazakhstani Jews]] [[Category:Eurasian Natural Resources Corporation]]

[[Image:American Chemistry Council Logo.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Logo of the American Chemistry Council.]]
The '''American Chemistry Council''' ('''ACC'''), formerly known as the '''Manufacturing Chemists' Association'''<ref>Ian R. Kenyon and Daniel Feakes, ''The Creation of the Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons: A Case Study in the Birth of an Intergovernmental Organisation'' (Cambridge University Press, 2007: {{ISBN|9067042412}}), p. 181.</ref> (at its founding in 1872<ref>Manufacturing Chemists' Association, ''The Chemical Industry Facts Book'' (Manufacturing Chemists' Association, Inc., 1961), p. 151.</ref>) and then as the '''Chemical Manufacturers' Association'''<ref>Cary Coglianese and Jennifer Nash, ''Regulating from the Inside: Can Environmental Management Systems Achieve Policy Goals?'' (Resources for the Future, 2001: {{ISBN|1-891853-41-4}}), p. 64.</ref> (from 1978 until 2000<ref>Brian Rothery, ''Standards and Certification in Europe'' (Gower, 1996: {{ISBN|0-566-07644-6}}), p. 129.</ref><ref>Charles Perrow, ''The Next Catastrophe: Reducing Our Vulnerabilities to Natural, Industrial, and Terrorist Disasters'' (Princeton University Press, 2007: {{ISBN|0-691-12997-5}}), p. 129.</ref>), is an industry [[trade association]] for American chemical companies, based in [[Washington, D.C.]]
==Activities== [[File:Albatross at Midway Atoll Refuge (8080507529).jpg|thumb|In 2011, the ACC was a major sponsor of the 5th International Marine Debris Conference which endorsed the [[Honolulu Commitment]] to reduce harmful plastics in the environment<ref>[https://5imdc.wordpress.com/ Fifth International Marine Debris Conference], 5imdc.org. URL accessed February 18, 2018</ref>]]The mission of the American Chemistry Council is to promote the interests of companies engaged in the [[chemical industry|business of chemistry]]. The trade group represents US chemical companies as well as the plastics and chlorine industries, formerly known as the [[American Plastics Council]], the Center for the Polyurethanes Industry and the Chlorine Chemistry Council.
The ACC implemented the [[Responsible Care]] program in 1988. At least 52 countries have implemented this initiative. It is managed at a global level by the [[International Council of Chemical Associations]].
The ACC has a [[political action committee]] that gives money to members of the [[Congress of the United States]].
The ACC launched a $35 million "essential2" public relations campaign in 2005.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases-test/american-chemistry-council-celebrates-launch-of-essential2-campaign-55421652.html |title=American Chemistry Council Celebrates Launch of 'essential2' |publisher=Prnewswire.com |date= |accessdate=2013-06-17}}</ref> "essential2" attempted to improve the industry's image by emphasizing the importance of chemical industry products – especially [[plastic]]s – to everyday life, and by using the term "American Chemistry" rather than "[[chemical]] industry". The ACC later shifted to a more directed lobbying and policy-shaping effort,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.americanchemistry.com/Media/PressReleasesTranscripts/ACC-news-releases/ACC-Launches-New-PlatformHighlights-Innovation-Jobs-and-Safety.html |title=ACC Launches New Platform – Highlights Innovation, Jobs and Safety |publisher=Americanchemistry.com |date=2011-05-24 |accessdate=2013-06-17}}</ref> including taking legal action against federal efforts to regulate greenhouse gas emissions from industry.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://newsandinsight.thomsonreuters.com/Legal/News/2013/04_-_April/Supreme_Court_asked_to_hear_EPA_greenhouse_gas_challenge/ |title=Supreme Court asked to hear EPA greenhouse gas challenge |publisher=Newsandinsight.thomsonreuters.com |date=2013-04-22 |accessdate=2013-06-17}}</ref>
==Criticism== Some critics{{who|date=October 2011}} believe that the Responsible Care program is intended to help the industry avoid regulation by imposing its own safety and environmental regulations, and to improve its [[public relations|public image]] in the wake of the 1984 [[Bhopal disaster]]. Defenders{{who|date=October 2011}} of the Responsible Care standard claim the program has improved safety and that its standards are higher than some [[Occupational Safety and Health Administration|OSHA]] regulations.
[[Environmentalist]]s and those concerned about the health effects of chemicals in the environment traditionally oppose the ACC's initiatives. They view campaigns like "essential2" as efforts to distract public attention away from products and practices that they view as harmful and dangerous. Among the most vocal opponents are groups such as [[Pesticide Action Network]] and [[Environmental Working Group]].
The American Chemistry Council is involved in and shaping [[public policy]] discussions when necessary to defend its members' special needs from the effects of legislation. This has proven particularly true when the public interest points to changes in industry practice that might be detrimental to the relative financial success of members.{{citation needed|date=October 2011}} By combining funds from the collective [[chemical industry]] as a whole and then using this money to steer public debate, the American Chemistry Council has repeatedly demonstrated its efficiency at obtaining outcomes favorable for the special interests of the chemical industry.{{citation needed|date=October 2011}}
Sometime in 2008, the ACC launched a campaign<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bpafacts.org/ |title=Facts About BPA |publisher=Bpafacts.org |date= |accessdate=2013-06-17}}</ref> to oppose [[California State Legislature|California]] SB1713 – a bill to ban [[bisphenol A]] statewide<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.legislature.ca.gov/cgi-bin/port-postquery?bill_number=sb_1713&sess=CUR&house=B&author=migden |title=Bill Document |publisher=Legislature.ca.gov |date= |accessdate=2013-06-17}}</ref> – including bulk postal mailings in July and August encouraging California citizens to demand opposition of their representing legislators.
The American Chemistry Council's stance on chemical regulation was heavily criticized in the 2015 documentary [[Stink!]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Stink! The Movie The Chemical Industry Doesn't Want You To See|url=https://stinkmovie.com/|website=Stink! Movie}}</ref>
==Plastic bag regulation== The ACC was heavily engaged in fighting governmental restrictions and bans on [[plastic shopping bag]]s.{{citation needed|date=October 2011}} The [[phase-out of lightweight plastic bags]] has been proposed or implemented in many countries since 2002. In the United States, in July 2008, the [[Seattle City Council]] voted to impose an additional 20 cent fee on each [[plastic bag]] purchased from stores by shoppers as a convenience for transportation of goods. This effort was suspended until a referendum could be held in 2009, allowing voters a chance to weigh in on the issue of whether they should continue to be encouraged to support industry by purchasing plastic bags without considering disposal costs. During the period leading up to the referendum vote the American Chemistry Council stepped into this local affair, ultimately spending some $1.4 million on their successful effort to thwart the proposed system of [[full cost accounting|fully accounting for the cost]] of plastic bags. Seattle in 2012 overcame ACC objections and successfully enacted a bag ban.
In 2010 the ACC was quoted by ''[[The New York Times]]'' in opposition to a California bill to outlaw plastic bags, claiming that new law "amounts to a $1 billion tax added to [Californian's] grocery bills."<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/06/03/science/earth/03bags.html | work=The New York Times | first=Felicity | last=Barringer | title=In California, a Step Toward B.Y.O.B. (Bring Your Own Bag) | date=2010-06-02}}</ref>
But subsequent ACC efforts to prevent adoption of municipal ordinances banning plastic bags have not been successful. Over ACC opposition, San Jose, California, in 2010 adopted California's strictest ban. The ordinance, in effect since 2012, prohibits supermarkets, pharmacies, corner shops and others from distributing single-use plastic bags, with fines for violations. Retailers can sell [[paper bag]]s made of 40 percent recycled materials for 10 cents each, gradually increasing to 25 cents by 2014.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.sfgate.com/green/article/San-Jose-OKs-state-s-toughest-ban-on-plastic-bags-2453280.php |title=San Jose OKs state's toughest ban on plastic bags |publisher=SFGate |date=2010-12-15 |accessdate=2013-06-17 |first=Kelly |last=Zito}}</ref> In 2016, California voters approved a statewide ban on carry-out plastic bags.<ref name="cal-16">{{cite news|last1=Luna|first1=Taryn|title=Californians say farewell to the plastic bag|url=http://www.sacbee.com/news/politics-government/capitol-alert/article113898813.html|accessdate=21 February 2018|work=The Sacramento Bee|date=10 November 2016}}</ref>

Other products include [[Epogen]], [[darbepoetin|Aranesp]], [[Sensipar]]/[[Mimpara]], [[Nplate]], [[Vectibix]], [[Prolia]] and [[Denosumab|XGEVA]]. Pages 128–129. {{ISBN|9780897812993}}. == History == [[Image:AMGenelogo.jpg|thumb|right|AMGen corporate logo, 1983]] [[Image:G5-N551GA-070919-04cr-16.jpg|thumb|right|Amgen's corporate [[Gulfstream V]] departs [[Fox Field]], [[Lancaster, California]]]] [[File:Macri Amgen.jpg|thumb|Argentine president [[Mauricio Macri]] meets with heads of Amgen, in 2018]] The word '''AMGen''' is a [[portmanteau]] of the company's original name, '''A'''pplied '''M'''olecular '''Gen'''etics, which became the official name of the company in 1983 (three years after incorporation and coincident with its [[initial public offering]]). The company's first [[chief executive officer]], from 1980, was co-founder [[George Rathmann|George B. Rathmann]], followed by [[Gordon Binder|Gordon M. Binder]] in 1988,{{cite web|url=http://edgar.secdatabase.com/237/31815498000003/filing-main.htm |title=Amgen, Form 10-K, Annual Report, Filing Date Mar 24, 1998 |publisher=secdatabase.com |accessdate =Jan 8, 2013}} followed by [[Kevin W. Sharer]] in 2000.{{cite web|url=http://edgar.secdatabase.com/227/89843000000676/filing-main.htm |title=Amgen, Form 10-K405, Filing Date Mar 7, 2000 |publisher=secdatabase.com |accessdate =Jan 8, 2013}} Robert A. Bradway became Amgen’s president and chief executive officer in May 2012 following Sharer's retirement.{{cite web|url=http://edgar.secdatabase.com/1218/119312512245437/filing-main.htm |title=Amgen, Form 8-K, Current Report, Filing Date May 24, 2012 |publisher=secdatabase.com |accessdate =Jan 8, 2013}} The company has made at least five major [[Mergers and acquisitions|corporate acquisitions]]. ==Timeline== *1980. William Bowes from Cetus Corporation recruits Winston Salser from UCLA to start Amgen with a scientific advisory board consisting of [[Norman Davidson (biologist)|Normam Davidson]], [[Leroy Hood]], [[Arnold Berk]], [[John Carbon]], [[Robert Schimke]], [[Arno Motulsky]], [[Marvin H. Caruthers]], and Dave Gibson.{{cite web|title=Amgen—A biotechnology success story {{!}} From drug development to the mass market|url=https://www.marsdd.com/mars-library/amgen-a-biotechnology-success-story-from-drug-development-to-the-mass-market/}} *1989. Amgen received approval for the first recombinant human erythropoetin product, Epogen, for the treatment of anemia associated with chronic kidney failure. Epogen (also marketed by Johnson and Johnson under the tradename Procrit) would later be approved for anemia due to cancer chemotherapy, anemia due to treatment with certain HIV drugs, and for the reduction of the need for transfusions associated with surgery.{{cite web |url=http://www.accessdata.fda.gov/scripts/cder/drugsatfda/index.cfm?fuseaction=Search.Set_Current_Drug&ApplNo=103795&DrugName=ENBREL&ActiveIngred=ETANERCEPT&SponsorApplicant=IMMUNEX&ProductMktStatus=1&goto=Search.DrugDetails |title=Drugs@FDA: FDA Approved Drug Products |format= |work= |accessdate=}} * 1991. In February 1991, Amgen received FDA approval for Neupogen for the prevention of infections in patients whose immune systems are suppressed due to cancer chemotherapy.{{cite web |url=http://www.accessdata.fda.gov/scripts/cder/drugsatfda/index.cfm?fuseaction=Search.Set_Current_Drug&ApplNo=103353&DrugName=NEUPOGEN&ActiveIngred=FILGRASTIM&SponsorApplicant=AMGEN&ProductMktStatus=1&goto=Search.DrugDetails |title=Drugs@FDA: FDA Approved Drug Products |format= |work= |accessdate=}} A 2002 meta-analysis found that Neupogen treatment reduced the risk of febrile neutropenia by 38%, reduced the risk of documented infection by 49%, and reduced the risk of infection-related mortality by 40%.{{cite journal |vauthors=Lyman GH, Kuderer NM, Djulbegovic B |title=Prophylactic granulocyte colony-stimulating factor in patients receiving dose-intensive cancer chemotherapy: a meta-analysis |journal=Am. J. Med. |volume=112 |issue=5 |pages=406–11 |date=April 2002 |pmid=11904116 |doi= 10.1016/s0002-9343(02)01036-7|url=}} * 1998. In November 1998, Immunex, a future acquisition of Amgen, received approval for Enbrel (etanercept), the first rheumatoid arthritis drug targeting tumor necrosis factor alpha (TNF-alpha). A 2006 assessment by the National Institute of Clinical Excellence of the United Kingdom concluded that etanercept and related rheumatoid arthritis drugs later introduced by competitors "are effective treatments compared with placebo for RA patients who are not well controlled by conventional DMARDs, improving control of symptoms, improving physical function, and slowing radiographic changes in joints."{{cite journal |vauthors=Chen YF, Jobanputra P, Barton P |title=A systematic review of the effectiveness of adalimumab, etanercept and infliximab for the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis in adults and an economic evaluation of their cost-effectiveness |journal=Health Technol Assess |volume=10 |issue=42 |pages=iii–iv, xi–xiii, 1–229 |date=November 2006 |pmid=17049139 |doi= 10.3310/hta10420|url=|display-authors=etal}} A more recent study demonstrated that compared to traditional disease-modifying anti-rheumatic drugs, treatment with etanercept improved survival, reduced cardiovascular events and reduced the incidence of hematological cancers.{{cite journal |vauthors=Morgan CL, Emery P, Porter D |title=Treatment of rheumatoid arthritis with etanercept with reference to disease-modifying anti-rheumatic drugs: long-term safety and survival using prospective, observational data |journal=Rheumatology (Oxford) |volume=53 |issue=1 |pages=186–94 |date=January 2014 |pmid=24140761 |doi=10.1093/rheumatology/ket333 |url=|display-authors=etal}} * 2010. On June 6, 2010 Amgen received FDA approval for Prolia, a protein drug for the treatment of post-menopausal osteoporosis.{{cite web |url=http://www.accessdata.fda.gov/scripts/cder/drugsatfda/index.cfm?fuseaction=Search.Set_Current_Drug&ApplNo=125320&DrugName=PROLIA&ActiveIngred=DENOSUMAB&SponsorApplicant=AMGEN&ProductMktStatus=1&goto=Search.Label_ApprovalHistory |title=Drugs@FDA: FDA Approved Drug Products |format= |work= |accessdate=}} In clinical trials, Prolia reduced the rate of vertebral fractures by 61% and the risk of hip fractures by 40%.{{cite web |url=http://www.accessdata.fda.gov/drugsatfda_docs/label/2010/125320s0000lbl.pdf |title=www.accessdata.fda.gov |format= |work= |accessdate=}} * 2010 In November 2010 the FDA approved Xgeva for the prevention of complications of bone metastases in patients with solid tumors.{{cite web |url=http://www.fda.gov/NewsEvents/Newsroom/PressAnnouncements/ucm234346.htm |title=FDA approves Xgeva to help prevent cancer-related bone injury |work= |accessdate=}} The clinical trials primarily enrolled patients with breast or prostate cancer. * 2012. Illegal marketing practices. The ''[[Los Angeles Times]]'' reported on December 18, 2012, that AMGEN pleaded guilty and agreed to pay $150 million in criminal penalty and $612 million to resolve 11 related [[whistleblower]] complaints. Federal prosecutors accused the company of pursuing profits while putting patients at risk.{{cite news|last=Terhune|first=Chad|title=Amgen pleads guilty to improper marketing of anemia drug Aranesp|url=http://articles.latimes.com/2012/dec/18/business/la-fi-amgen-plea-20121219|publisher=Los Angeles Times|accessdate=2 February 2013|date=18 December 2012}} Larry Husten, a contributor at Forbes.com elaborates on AMGEN's illegal marketing practices in this case, namely that the "government accused Amgen of marketing Aranesp for indications not approved by the FDA and other illegal marketing practices".{{cite news|last=Husten|first=Larry|title=Amgen Pleads Guilty To Misbranding Anemia Drug Aranesp|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/larryhusten/2012/12/18/amgen-pleads-guilty-to-misbranding-anemia-drug-aranesp/|publisher=Forbes|accessdate=2 February 2013}} One of the drugs mentioned in the lawsuit had sales of $492 million in the third quarter of 2012, down 17% from the same quarter the previous year due to "reimbursement problems and label changes".{{cite web |url=http://www.pharmatimes.com/Article/13-01-17/Amgen_s_Aranesp_fails_in_heart_trial_Singapore_plant_planned.aspx |title=Article > Amgen's Aranesp fails in heart trial, Singapore plant planned |format= |work= |accessdate=}} * 2013. Lawmakers inserted text into the fiscal cliff bill that will allow the drugmaker to sell a class of drugs that includes Sensipar without government controls for an additional two years. The New York Times estimated that the paragraph in the fiscal cliff bill will cost taxpayers an estimated $500 million{{cite news|last=Lipton|first=Eric|title=Fiscal Footnote: Big Senate Gift to Drug Maker|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2013/01/20/us/medicare-pricing-delay-is-political-win-for-amgen-drug-maker.html?pagewanted=all|publisher=New York Times|accessdate=2 February 2013|date=19 January 2013}} but other assessments concluded that the change would protect seniors in rural areas and reduce overall Medicare spending.{{cite news |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/jon-entine/after-congressional-budge_b_2759676.html |title=Jon Entine: New York Times Mum After Congressional Budget Office Rebukes Bungled Amgen/Medicare Investigation |work= Huffington Post|accessdate= |date=26 February 2013}}{{cite web|url=http://www.nephrologynews.com/articles/109331-cbo-analysis-shows-keeping-oral-drugs-out-of-esrd-bundle-could-save-money |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130605171126/http://www.nephrologynews.com/articles/109331-cbo-analysis-shows-keeping-oral-drugs-out-of-esrd-bundle-could-save-money |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2013-06-05 |title=CBO analysis shows keeping oral drugs out of ESRD bundle could save money | Nephrology News & Issues |format= |work= |accessdate= }} *2015. In September the company announced it would acquire Dezima Pharma for more than $1.55 billion.{{cite web|url=http://www.genengnews.com/gen-news-highlights/for-up-to-1-55b-amgen-acquires-dezima-pharma/81251735/|title=For Up to $1.55B, Amgen Acquires Dezima Pharma|work=GEN}} The same day the company announced a collaboration with [[Xencor]] on 6 early stage immuno-oncology and inflammation programmes. The '''Bronfman family''' is a [[History of the Jews in Canada|Canadian Jewish]] [[family]].{{cite web|last=Curtis|first=Christopher G.|title=Bronfman Family|url=http://www.thecanadianencyclopedia.com/articles/bronfman-family |work=The Canadian Encyclopedia |accessdate=22 December 2013 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131020061029/http://www.thecanadianencyclopedia.com/articles/bronfman-family|archivedate=October 20, 2013|deadurl=no}} It owes its initial fame to [[Samuel Bronfman]] (1889–1971), who made a fortune in the alcoholic [[distilled beverage]] business during the 20th century through the family's [[Seagram]] Company.{{cite web|last=The Editors of Encyclopædia Britannica|title=Seagram Company Ltd.|url=http://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/530859/Seagram-Company-Ltd|work=Encyclopædia Britannica|accessdate=22 December 2013}} The family is of [[Russian Jewish]] and [[History of the Jews in Romania|Romanian Jewish]] ancestry; "they were originally tobacco farmers from [[Bessarabia]]".{{cite news|last1=Weiss|first1=Steven I.|title=For Centuries, Jews Ruled Poland's Liquor Trade. Why Was That Legacy Forgotten?|url=http://www.tabletmag.com/jewish-news-and-politics/165467/jews-and-booze|accessdate=April 10, 2016|work=Tablet|date=March 11, 2014|quote=Even the Bronfmans, the world's most famous liquor magnates, couldn't tie their successes in booze to the legacy of Polish Jewry's tavern-keeping: They were originally tobacco farmers from Bessarabia.}} According to ''[[New York Times]]'' staff reporter, Nathaniel Popper, the Bronfman family is "perhaps the single largest force in the Jewish charitable world."{{cite news|last=Popper|first=Nathaniel|title=Keeping Alive a Philanthropic Family Tradition|url=http://forward.com/articles/3284/keeping-alive-a-philanthropic-family-tradition/|accessdate=24 December 2013|newspaper=The Jewish Daily Forward|date=April 15, 2005}}{{cite news |last=Kandell| first=Jonathan |title=Edgar M. '''Daniel McKorley ''' (born June 14, 1978) is a Ghanaian [[business magnate]],founder and [[chief executive officer]] of McDan Group of Companies.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.ahomkafm.com/?p=26475|title=McDan donates GH¢50,000 to repair tennis court at Accra Sports Stadium {{!}}|website=www.ahomkafm.com|language=en-US|access-date=2017-10-03}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://sport.citifmonline.com/2017/04/11/mcdan-pledges-gh%C2%A250000-to-renovate-accra-stadium-tennis-court/|title=McDan pledges GH¢50,000 to renovate Accra Stadium tennis court {{!}} Citi Sport|website=sport.citifmonline.com|language=en-US|access-date=2017-10-03}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://kessbenfm.com/laziness-killing-ghanaian-youth-mcdan/|title=Laziness is ‘killing’ Ghanaian youth – McDan|publisher=kessbenfm.com}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://ghananewsfeed.com/mcdan-supports-42nd-mtn-swag-awards|title=Account Suspended|website=ghananewsfeed.com|access-date=2017-10-03}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://starrfmonline.com/2017/04/10/mcdan-promises-to-refurbish-national-tennis-courts/|title=Mcdan promises to refurbish National Tennis Courts|publisher=starrfmonline.com}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://m.myjoyonline.com/marticles/sports/mcdan-supports-42nd-mtnswag-awards|title=McDan supports 42nd MTN-SWAG Awards |publisher=myjoyonline.com}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.afwestinternational.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=50&Itemid=54|title=About us|publisher=afwestinternational.com}}</ref> He is a graduate of Business Management and has been a business entrepreneur for more than ten years. Mckorley was adjudged the Entrepreneur of the year - 2016 at the Ghana Aviation Awards.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.graphic.com.gh/news/general-news/33-companies-individuals-honoured-at-aviation-awards.html|title=Ghana news: 33 Companies, individuals honoured at Aviation Awards - Graphic Online|last=Graphic|first=Daily|work=Graphic Online|access-date=2017-10-03|language=en-GB}}</ref>
==Early life== Mckorley was born on June 14, 1978 in Labadi, Accra. He attended his primary school at the same community and further his education at the senior high level. After his High school education he gained admission to study at the University of Ghana but dropped out because he could not pay his school fees.
==Education== He holds Executive Masters in Business Administration (EMBA) and a Certificate degree in Entrepreneurship both from the Ghana Institute of Management and Public Administration (GIMPA). He also holds diplomas in Leadership and Transport & Logistics. A commercially astute executive with a wealth of experience gained within the freight forwarding, haulage, logistics and private security industry, both locally & internationally has contributed an Honorary Doctorate Degree from Commonwealth University, London Business School, UK. Proven records of dramatically improving clearance & delivery times in the transport, haulage & logistic field whilst managing high value asset investments and adding value to customer’s overall experience.
==Business== Daniel McKorley is the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of the McDan Group of Companies.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://starrfmonline.com/2017/04/10/mcdan-promises-to-refurbish-national-tennis-courts/|title=Mcdan promises to refurbish National Tennis Courts|date=10 April 2017|publisher=starrfmonline.com}}</ref> He revealed that he dropped out of the University because he could not pay his school fees.Arguably one of the most successful businessmen in Ghana, Daniel McKorley could only attain a degree 15 years, after dropping out of the University of Ghana. He started the McDan Shipping Company which was established in November 1999, with headquartered in Accra and Branches in Tema and Takoradi.The company has a presence in over 2000 major air and sea ports worldwide due to a partnership with Universal Freight Organization, Cross Trades and World Cargo Alliance(WCA).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://ghanapoliticsonline.com/i-dropped-out-of-the-university-because-i-could-not-pay-fees-mcdan-ceo/|title=I dropped out of the University because I could not pay fees- McDan CEO|date=7 June 2017|publisher=ghanapoliticsonline.com}}</ref>
==Humanity== McKorley presented an air-conditioned Benz Bus (Sprinter) to the Ghana Tennis Federation at the McDan Tennis Open West African Championship at the Accra Stadium in May 2017.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://ghheadlines.com/agency/ghana-web-/20170503/39299728/mcdan-donates-bus-to-ghana-tennis-federation|title=McDan donates bus to Ghana Tennis Federation|date=3 May 2017|publisher=ghheadlines.com}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.graphic.com.gh/sports/tennis/mcdan-donates-bus-to-ghana-tennis-federation.html|title=McDan donates bus to Ghana Tennis Federation|date=2 May 2017|publisher=www.graphic.com.gh}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://pulse.mtn.com.gh/news/sports/ghana-tennis-federation-gets-a-mini-bus-from-mcdan-22436/|title=Ghana Tennis Federation gets a mini bus from McDan|date=3 May 2017|publisher=pulse.mtn.com.gh}}</ref> Daniel McKorley presented an amount of GHC10, 000 to the Sports Writers Association of Ghana (SWAG) in support of the 2017 SWAG Awards Night at the Banquet Hall of the State House.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.primenewsghana.com/sports/mcdan-donates-ghc10-000-to-swag-ahead-of-awards-night.html|title=McDan donates GHC10,000 towards SWAG awards.|date=26 May 2017|publisher=primenewsghana.com}}</ref>
==Recognition== *The achievers Award by West Africa Regional magazine *Ernst & Young entrepreneur of West Africa Nominee - 2015 *The Entrepreneur of the year - 2016<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ghanaweb.com/GhanaHomePage/economy/artikel.php?ID=459477&channel=D1|title=33 companies and individuals honoured at Aviation Awards|publisher=ghanaweb.com}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://dailyguideafrica.com/33-aviation-companies-honoured/|title=33 Aviation Companies Honoured|publisher=dailyguideafrica.com}}</ref> *Freight Forwarding and entrepreneur of the year - 2013<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.graphic.com.gh/business/business-news/ghanaian-entrepreneurs-honoured.html|title=Ghanaian entrepreneurs honoured |publisher=graphic.com.gh}}</ref> *[[Chartered Institute of Marketing Ghana|CIMG]] Marketing Man of the Year 2017<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.businessghana.com/site/news/business/173527/MacDan-CEO-emerges-CIMG-Marketing-Man-of-the-year|title=Bususiness Ghana - News Business|website=www.businessghana.com|access-date=2018-10-05}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.primenewsghana.com/general-news/all-winners-at-the-29th-cimg-marketing-awards.html|title=CIMG Awards : CEO of McDan Shipping wins Marketing Man of the Year|last=Yakubu|first=Mutala|work=Primenewsghana.com|access-date=2018-10-05|language=en-GB}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://allafrica.com/stories/201810010594.html|title=Ghana: McDan Adjudged Marketing Man of the Year 2017|last=Asare|first=Kingsley|date=2018-10-01|work=Ghanaian Times (Accra)|access-date=2018-10-05}}</ref>
==Family== Mr. McKorley is married to Mrs. Abigail McKorley with kids.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.modernghana.com/sports/799426/mcdan-dreams-big-in-support-of-tennis.html|title=McDan Dreams Big In Support Of Tennis|work=ModernGhana.com|access-date=2017-10-03|language=en-GB}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.modernghana.com/news/478920/1/autism-centre-gets-support-from-the-mckorleys.html|title=Autism Centre gets support from the McKorleys|work=ModernGhana.com|access-date=2017-10-03|language=en-GB}}</ref>

'''Amalie Luise Elisabeth Haub''' (September 20, 1899 in [[Mülheim an der Ruhr]] – January 24, 1977 in [[Bonn]]) was a German heiress, [[philanthropist]] and [[environmentalist]].
==Life and work== Elisabeth was born in 1899 to entrepreneur Karl Schmitz-Scholl Sr. and his wife Elisabeth, née Weynen, in Mülheimer, to what was a merchant family. When her father died in 1933, she and her brother Karl Schmitz-Scholl Jr. inherited their father's company, Unternehmensgruppe Tengelmann, now [[Tengelmann Group|Tengelmann Warenhandelsgesellschaft KG]]. She looked after the business until her brother's return from captivity in 1947. Her son, [[Erivan Haub]] took over in 1969 after Karl Schmitz-Scholl Jr.'s death as he was childless, remaining at the helm for three decades.<ref name=Bloomberg>{{cite web|last1=Cruz|first1=Julie|last2=De Jong|first2=David|title=Tengelmann Billionaire Haub Retires as Outsiders Win Role|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2013-01-21/tengelmann-billionaire-haub-retires-as-outsiders-win-role|website=Bloomberg|publisher=Bloomberg|accessdate=5 August 2015}}</ref>
==Philanthropy== To mark the centenary of her father's birth, she founded the Karl Schmitz-Scholl Fund in 1968, a foundation for the promotion of environmental protection.<ref name="KissBurhenne-Guilmin1994">{{cite book|author1=Alexandre Charles Kiss|author2=Françoise Burhenne-Guilmin|title=A Law for the Environment: Essays in Honour of Wolfgang E. Burhenne|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=eSn3q7H-IBMC&pg=PA2|date=1 January 1994|publisher=IUCN|isbn=978-2-8317-0203-2|pages=2–}}</ref>
Since 1973, the International Council of Environmental Law (ICEL) and the [[Université Libre de Bruxelles]] have annually awarded the Elizabeth Haub Prize for Environmental Law. This task is performed by an international jury consisting of six prominent environment lawyers, which considers the most important diplomatic achievements in the field of environmental law and policy in the preceding year.<ref name="University of Delaware">{{cite web|last1=Boyle|first1=Elizabeth|title=Cicin-Sain named laureate for Haub Award for Environmental Diplomacy|url=http://www.udel.edu/udaily/2011/feb/environmental-diplomacy-021011.html|website=University of Delaware|publisher=University of Delaware|accessdate=5 August 2015}}</ref> In 2008, this task was taken over by the [[University of Stockholm]]. Since 1998, the ICEL together with [[Pace University]] also award the Elizabeth Haub Prize for Environmental Diplomacy.<ref name="Lausche2008">{{cite book|author=Barbara J. Lausche|title=Weaving a Web of Environmental Law|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=g-VNAQAAIAAJ|year=2008|publisher=Schmidt|isbn=978-3-503-11045-2}}</ref><ref name="Wyszomierski2006">{{cite book|author=Sara Wyszomierski|title=Guide to Funding for International & Foreign Programs|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=prwTAQAAMAAJ|year=2006|publisher=Foundation Center}}</ref><ref name="Pace University">{{cite web|title=Elizabeth Haub Award for Environmental Diplomacy|url=http://www.law.pace.edu/elizabeth-haub-award|website=Pace University|publisher=Pace University|accessdate=5 August 2015}}</ref><ref name=IUCN>{{cite web|title=Elizabeth Haub Prize 2007|url=http://iucn.org/news_homepage/news_by_date/2008_news/?2415/Elizabeth-Haub-Prize-2007|website=IUCN|publisher=IUCN|accessdate=5 August 2015}}</ref><ref name="Dagens Juridik">{{cite web|title=Advokat tillika juridikprofessor belönas för "exceptionella prestationer" - tilldelas aktat pris|url=http://www.dagensjuridik.se/2014/11/advokat-tillika-juridikprofessor-belonas-exceptionella-prestationer-tilldelas-aktat-pris|website=Dagens Juridik|publisher=Dagens Juridik|accessdate=5 August 2015}}</ref>
In 1975 she founded the Haub Zais Foundation for Monument Protection in [[Wiesbaden]]. The Foundation is named after her late husband, Erich Haub, and his great-grandfather, the city architect, [[Christian Zais]].<ref name="Wiesbadener Kurier">{{cite web|last1=Oxfort|first1=Christina|title=Beim "Immobilienforum Wiesbaden" im Rathaus sprechen Experten über Einsparpotenzial und Fördermöglichkeiten beim Denkmalschutz|url=http://www.wiesbadener-kurier.de/lokales/wiesbaden/nachrichten-wiesbaden/beim-immobilienforum-wiesbaden-im-rathaus-sprechen-experten-ueber-einsparpotenzial-und-foerdermoeglichkeiten-beim-denkmalschutz_15433330.htm|website=Wiesbadener Kurier|publisher=Wiesbadener Kurier|accessdate=5 August 2015}}</ref><ref name="Frankfurter Rundshau">{{cite web|last1=FIEDLER|first1=UTE|title=Wie ein Überraschungsei|url=http://www.fr-online.de/wiesbaden/denkmalschutz-fachwerk-wie-ein-ueberraschungsei,1472860,16985836.html|website=Frankfurter Rundshau|publisher=Frankfurter Rundshau|accessdate=5 August 2015}}</ref>
Her daughter-in-law, Helga Haub, established the Elizabeth Haub Foundations for Environmental Law and Policy, with offices in Washington DC and Toronto. To mark the 75th birthday of Erivan Haub, the Elizabeth Haub Foundation established an office in Germany. Helga Haub remains chairwoman of the organisation.<ref>{{cite book|title=Resolutions and recommendations: World Conservation Congress, Jeju, Republic of Korea, 6-15 September 2012|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=kAb7Sbh0iJ0C&pg=PA182|publisher=IUCN|isbn=978-2-8317-1576-6|pages=182–}}</ref><ref>{{cite book|title=Guide to U.S. Foundations, Their Trustees, Officers, and Donors|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=sF0UAQAAMAAJ|year=2006|publisher=The Center|isbn=978-1-59542-082-4}}</ref><ref name="Great Falls Tribune">{{cite web|last1=Puckett|first1=Karl|title=Prairie reserve still attracting fans, foes|url=http://www.greatfallstribune.com/story/news/local/2015/06/18/prairie-reserve-still-attracting-fans-foes/28944461/|website=Great Falls Tribune|publisher=Great Falls Tribune|accessdate=5 August 2015}}</ref>
As of 2015, the latest recipients of the Elizabeth Haub Award for Environmental Diplomacy are [[Macharia Kamau]] and Csaba Kőrösi, [[Permanent Representatives to the United Nations]] for Kenya and Hungary, respectively. This prize was awarded in the presence of [[UN Secretary-General]] [[Ban Ki-moon]].<ref name="United Nations">{{cite web|title=Secretary-General Honours Macharia Kamau, Csaba Kőrösi as Recipients of Elizabeth Haub Award for Environmental Diplomacy|url=https://www.un.org/press/en/2015/sgsm16975.doc.htm|website=United Nations|publisher=United Nations|accessdate=5 August 2015}}</ref>
On May 5, 2016, Pace University announced that its law school, renowned for its environmental law program, was renamed the Elisabeth Haub School of Law, in recognition of Haub's tireless environmental advocacy and philanthropy.<ref>http://law.pace.edu/sites/default/files/pdfs/Haub%20Announcement%20Press%20Release%20(final).pdf</ref>

[http://www.rigneydolphin.ie/team.html RigneyDolphin Ltd. Bio] | spouse = Adrienne Dolphin | children = 5 }} '''Frank Dolphin''' is an Irish businessman. He is known for his involvement with the [[Health Service Executive|Irish Health Service]],{{cite press release |url=http://www.dohc.ie/press/releases/2010/20100728.html |title=Minister announces appointment of Dr Frank Dolphin as next Chairman of Health Service Executive |publisher=Department of Health and Children |date=28 July 2010 |accessdate=28 July 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120227105420/http://www.dohc.ie/press/releases/2010/20100728.html |archivedate=27 February 2012 |df=dmy-all }}{{Cite news |last = Michael | first = Jason | title = New HSE chairman announced | newspaper = [[Irish Times]] | location = Dublin | date = 28 July 2010 | url = http://www.irishtimes.com/newspaper/breaking/2010/0728/breaking31.html | accessdate = 28 July 2010}} as a former chairman of [[Children's University Hospital, Temple Street]]{{Cite news | title = New chairman appointed to Temple Street board | newspaper = [[Evening Herald]] | location = Dublin | date = 12 April 2009 | url = http://www.herald.ie/breaking-news/national-news/new-chairman-appointed-to-temple-street-board-1706757.html | accessdate = 28 July 2010}} and Governor of the [[Mater Misericordiae University Hospital, Dublin|Mater Hospital]], as a past President of the Waterford [[Chamber of Commerce]], and for founding [[RigneyDolphin Ltd.]]. __TOC__ ==Education== Frank Dolphin was born in [[Birr, County Offaly|Birr]], [[County Offaly]] and attended Presentation College in Birr. He subsequently attended [[University College Dublin]], where he obtained a PhD in Psychology.{{Cite thesis |degree= PhD |title= Psychological indicators for therapy with the young confirmed stutterer |url= http://udprism01.ucd.ie/TalisPrism/doSearch.do |last= Dolphin |first= Frank |year= 1988 |publisher= University College Dublin |accessdate= 29 July 2010 |deadurl= yes |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100819094334/http://udprism01.ucd.ie/TalisPrism/doSearch.do |archivedate= 19 August 2010 |df= dmy-all }} His early research{{Cite thesis |degree= M.A. |title= Stuttering: a complex of conflicts |url= http://udprism01.ucd.ie/TalisPrism/doSearch.do |last= Dolphin |first= Frank |year= 1983 |publisher= University College Dublin |accessdate= 29 July 2010 |deadurl= yes |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100819094334/http://udprism01.ucd.ie/TalisPrism/doSearch.do |archivedate= 19 August 2010 |df= dmy-all }} on information models in speech fluency was recognised by the [[British Psychological Society]] when he was awarded their Young Psychologist of the year award for his post graduate research. He lectured at [[Trinity College Dublin]] (covering the topics of Psychology and Consumer Behaviour) while working on his PhD at [[Children's University Hospital, Temple Street|Temple Street]]. After obtaining his PhD he moved to Waterford and set up the department of Psychology at the [[Waterford Institute of Technology]] (then Regional Technical College) and was responsible for introducing counselling and medical services there. He also worked as a consulting psychologist for [[Ferryhouse|St Joseph's Industrial School]], Clonmel. He currently sits on the board of Governors of WIT. ==RigneyDolphin Ltd.== In 1990 Dolphin left the [[Waterford Institute of Technology|WIT]] and founded [[RigneyDolphin Ltd.]]. He remains chairman of the firm. The firm initially offered a range of recruitment, HR and consultancy services but in recent years have focused on business support services. It cost €5 million and can accommodate 400 people.{{Cite news | title = 300 new jobs created in financial services | newspaper = [[Irish Independent]] | location = Dublin | date = 9 October 2007 | url = http://www.independent.ie/business/irish/300-new-jobs-created-in-financial-services-1138282.html | accessdate = 28 July 2010}} In 2009 RigneyDolphin were recognised by [[Deloitte]] as one of Ireland's ''"25 Best Managed Companies"''.{{cite press release |url=http://www.deloitte.com/view/en_IE/ie/news/ie-pressreleases-en/b747a68c4d101210VgnVCM100000ba42f00aRCRD.htm |title=Ireland's 25 Best Managed Companies announced! |publisher=[[Deloitte]] |date=21 May 2009 |accessdate=29 July 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110614035940/http://www.deloitte.com/view/en_IE/ie/news/ie-pressreleases-en/b747a68c4d101210VgnVCM100000ba42f00aRCRD.htm |archivedate=14 June 2011 |df=dmy-all }} In 2010 they upheld this award.{{cite web |url=http://www.deloitte.com/view/en_IE/ie/deloitte-best-managed-companies-awards/2010-requalifying-companies/index.htm |title=2010 requalifying companies |year=2010 |work=[[Deloitte]] |accessdate=29 July 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110614040049/http://www.deloitte.com/view/en_IE/ie/deloitte-best-managed-companies-awards/2010-requalifying-companies/index.htm |archivedate=14 June 2011 |df=dmy-all }} In December 2010 RigneyDolphin opened a 300 seat call centre in Derry. The new call centre, and its potential for employment, received praise from [[Department of Enterprise, Trade and Investment]] minister [[Arlene Foster]] and [[Martina Anderson]] of [[Sinn Féin]]. In February 2012 [[Taoiseach]] [[Enda Kenny]] announced that RigneyDolphin would provide patient management, patient outreach and telephone services to the [[Cleveland Clinic]].{{Cite news | title = New IT jobs after US deal welcomed | newspaper = [[Irish Times]] | location = Dublin | date = 17 February 2012 | url = http://www.irishtimes.com/newspaper/breaking/2012/0217/breaking3.html | accessdate = 20 December 2012}} ==Health Service== In 2009 Dolphin was appointed chairman of [[Children's University Hospital, Temple Street]].{{Cite web |last = Culliton | first = Gary | title = New chairman for Temple Street | publisher = Irish Medical Times | date = 20 April 2009 | url = http://www.imt.ie/blogs/hospital-medicine/2009/04/new-chairman-for-temple-street.html | accessdate = 29 July 2010}} In July 2010 the [[Minister for Health (Ireland)|Minister for Health and Children]] [[Mary Harney]] announced that Dolphin would assume the role of Chairman of the [[Health Service Executive]] with effect from 15 August 2010. Dolphin stepped down from this role in December 2011.{{cite press release |url=http://www.dohc.ie/press/releases/2012/20120316.html |title=Announcement of the composition of the Review Group into the National Paediatric Hospital |publisher=Department of Health and Children |date=16 March 2012 |accessdate=20 December 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121203160302/http://www.dohc.ie/press/releases/2012/20120316.html |archivedate=3 December 2012 |df=dmy-all }} In March 2012 Dolphin was chosen to lead the review group for the construction of [[new children's hospital (Dublin)|a new children's hospital]], following the refusal by [[An Bord Pleanála]] to give planning permission for the proposed Children's Hospital of Ireland at a site on Eccles Street. [[Enda Kenny]] stated that the report this group put forward (the "Dolphin Report") would be the only one used to decide on the location of the proposed hospital.{{Cite news | title = Children's hospital decision by three weeks, says Kenny | newspaper = [[Irish Times]] | location = Dublin | date = 23 October 2012 | url = http://www.irishtimes.com/newspaper/breaking/2012/1023/breaking42.html | accessdate = 20 December 2012}} The Dolphin Report did not rank locations, but left the final decision to the cabinet; in the end, [[St. James's Hospital]] was chosen as the site for the new children's hospital, with a €500m budget being allocated to the project. {{Cite news |last1=Wall |first1=Martin |last2=Doyle |first2=Kilian | title = National children's hospital to be built on St James's site | newspaper = [[Irish Times]] | location = Dublin | date = 6 November 2012 | url = http://www.irishtimes.com/newspaper/breaking/2012/1106/breaking3.html | accessdate = 20 December 2012}} == Chamber of Commerce == Dolphin was President of the Waterford Chamber of Commerce in '05/'06. While President he presented a paper to the [[International Chamber of Commerce#World Chambers Federation|World Chambers Federation's]] 4th World Chamber Congress in [[Durban]] on "Training Solutions". == References == {{Reflist}} == External links == * [https://web.archive.org/web/20100513030543/http://www.rigneydolphin.ie/team.html RigneyDolphin Profile] {{DEFAULTSORT:Dolphin, Frank}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:20th-century Irish people]] [[Category:21st-century Irish people]] [[Category:Irish businesspeople]] [[Category:People from County Offaly]] [[Category:Alumni of University College Dublin]] [[Category:Irish psychologists]]

Hampankatta also called as Happananakatte/Hampankatte/Hampananakatte/Hampanakatte. Most of the public utilities are located here and the locality boasts the most buzzing commercial activity in the city.{{cn|date=July 2018}}
==Mangalore Central== Rail connectivity in Mangalore was established in 1907. Mangalore was also the starting point of India's longest rail route. The city has two railway stations, [[Mangalore Central]] (at Hampankatta) and [[Mangalore Junction railway station|Mangalore Junction]] (at Kankanadi). A metre gauge railway track, built through the [[Western Ghats]], connects Mangalore with Hassan. The broad gauge track connecting Mangalore to Bangalore via Hassan was opened to freight traffic in May 2006 and passenger traffic in December 2007. Mangalore is also connected to Chennai through the [[Southern Railway (India)|Southern Railway]] and to [[Mumbai]] via the [[Konkan Railway]]

Grigoriy Nak (born 1990) |spouse = Elena Nak |awards = [[Russian Federation Presidential Certificate of Honour]] }} '''Igor Vladimirovich Nak''' (born on 6 August 1963, Moscow) is a Russian government and political figure, head of the [[United Russia|United Russia faction]] in the [[State Duma]] for the [[Yamalo-Nenets Autonomous Okrug]], head of the Council of the Deputy Faction, Chairman of the Coordinating Committee of the [[Russian Union of Industrialists and Entrepreneurs]] in the [[Ural Federal District]], deputy of the [[Tyumen]] Regional Duma for the single electoral district from the United Russia political party, entrepreneur, general director of [[Yamaltransstroy|Yamaltransstroy JSC]], [[Kandidat]] of Technical Sciences, and Honorary Transport Engineer of Russia. ==Biography== Born on 6 August 1963 in the city of Moscow. In 1985, he graduated from the [[Moscow State University of Railway Engineering|Institute of Railway Transport of the Moscow Order of Lenin and Order of the Red Banner of Labour]], specializing in "Construction of Railways, Tracks and Track Facilities". In 2004, he defended his dissertation and received the academic degree of candidate of technical sciences. From 1985, he worked as expert and works manufacturer in construction and installation train No. 643 of the Moselectrotyagstroy trust. From 1986, he worked as works manufacturer, Deputy Head and Head in construction and installation train No. 351 of Yamaltransstroy manufacturing construction and installation union ([[Labytnangi|Labytnangi city]]). Since 1997, he was First Deputy then General Director of [[Yamaltransstroy|Yamaltransstroy JSC]], one of Russia's largest companies for railway construction above the Arctic Circle on the [[Yamal Peninsula]]. ==Political activities== From 1990 to 1994: elected deputy of the City Council of People's Deputies of Labytnangi city. From 1994 to 1997: deputy of the city Duma. From 1996 to 1997: deputy of the State Duma of the [[Yamalo-Nenets Autonomous Okrug]]. {{BLP sources|date=September 2008}} '''Imraz Iqbal Ali''' is a [[Fiji]]an businessman, political activist, and former Television journalist, of [[India]]n descent. He does not normally use his last name, except for legal purposes. Together with [[Laisa Digitaki]], he is the co-owner of a magazine, ''[[Fiji Living]]'', based in Digitaki's home in the [[Lami, Fiji|Lami]] suburb of [[Vugalei]]. Iqbal also hosted a popular Fiji Diving adventure show during his Television Career.
He contested the [[Nasinu (Indian Communal Constituency, Fiji)|Nasinu]] [[Indians in Fiji|Indian]] [[Communal constituencies|Communal Constituency]] for the [[Soqosoqo Duavata ni Lewenivanua]] Party (SDL) at the [[Fijian general election, 2006|parliamentary election]] held on 6–13 May 2006. He polled only 226 votes out of more than 12,000 - some 1.9 percent of the total.
Iqbal strongly condemned the [[Republic of Fiji Military Forces]] for the [[2006 Fijian coup d'état|coup d'état]] of 5 December 2006. An article he published in ''Fiji Living'' resulted in [[Navy]] Commander [[Francis Kean]] summoning him to [[Suva]]'s [[Queen Elizabeth Barracks, Suva|Queen Elizabeth Barracks]] and warning him against speaking out against the Military, according to the [[Fiji Times]] and [[Fiji Village]] (11 December).<ref>[http://www.fijivillage.com/artman/publish/article_34325.shtml Fijivillage]</ref> A studio belonging to Iqbal (Infocus Arts Production House, on Disraeli Road) was destroyed by fire in the early hours of 24 December 2006, [[Fiji Television]] reported. Some [[Fijian dollar|F$250,000]] of equipment was lost. Iqbal said that with the [[National Fire Authority (Fiji)|National Fire Authority]] ruling out an electrical fault, he regarded the fire as suspicious.
In the early hours of 25 December, Iqbal was again summoned to the barracks, along with Digitaki, feminist leader [[Virisila Buadromo]], and a number of others. They were allegedly assaulted by soldiers before being ordered to walk home.<ref>[http://www.fijitimes.com/story.aspx?ref=archive&id=54128 FijiTimes]</ref> Commodore Bainimarama said the military would resist any attempts to destabilise it or thwart it's cleanup campaign. Speaking on a Fijian radio station talk back show, he named individuals that they were monitoring because they were inciting civil unrest. He warned members of the public and non government activists that included Fiji Women's Rights Movement executive director [[Virisila Buadromo]], Human right activists [[Imrana Jalal|Imarana (Patricia) Jalal]], journalist Imraz Iqbal and businesswoman [[Laisa Digitaki]] to stop saying things that would incite unrest in the country. Mr Bainimarama said these individuals had blamed the military for a fire in Lami the previous week, and he stated it was not the doing of the military. He said that these individuals should shut their mouth or else the military would shut it for them and they should not forget the death that had occurred at the military camp on November 2.
In September 2008 Iqbal again had a brush with the law. This time the Fiji Police force alleged him to be in possession of the missing gun of the 2000 coup. He was arrested and held for 3 days by the Fiji police force and released after numerous raids and searches found no weapons in his possession. His elderly father was also held by the police.
In an interview with [[Fiji Television]] immediately after his release, Iqbal thanked the Fiji Police force for being very professional in their conduct during his arrest.
